perturbation.original_text: Section 2. Promoter’s Fee. For providing services as set forth herein, VNUE will compensate Promoter i) Two Thousand Five Hundred Dollars ($2,500.00) for each One (1) Year contract Promoter secures per venue and Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000,00) for each Two (2) Year contract Promoter secures per venue, with payment due to Promoter within Thirty (30) Days from the date on which each such contract is countersigned; and ii) through the issuance of VNUE common stock as set forth below, and for the purposes of Rule 144 such shares of stock shall be deemed to have fully earned by Promoter upon the date of each issuance of such stock certificates by VStock Transfer:
perturbation.changed_text: Section 2. Promoter’s Fee. For providing services as set forth herein, VNUE will compensate Promoter i) Two Thousand Five Hundred Dollars ($2,500.00) for each One (1) Year contract Promoter secures per venue and Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000,00) for each Two (2) Year contract Promoter secures per venue, with payment due to Promoter within Sixty (60) Days from the date on which each such contract is countersigned; and ii) through the issuance of VNUE common stock as set forth below, and for the purposes of Rule 144 such shares of stock shall be deemed to have fully earned by Promoter upon the date of each issuance of such stock certificates by VStock Transfer:
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the payment terms. Section 2 initially states that payment is due within Thirty (30) Days from the countersigning of each contract, but this is changed to Sixty (60) Days. This contradiction will create uncertainty regarding the payment deadline, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: Section 3. Expenses. VNUE shall reimburse Promoter for expenses incurred by Promoter while performing the duties herein. Promoter shall deliver to VNUE an itemized accounting of expenses incurred on a weekly basis, and VNUE shall reimburse Promoter within Thirty (30) Days of receipt of such accounting.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 3. Expenses. VNUE shall reimburse Promoter for reasonable expenses incurred by Promoter while performing the duties herein. Promoter shall deliver to VNUE an itemized accounting of expenses incurred on a monthly basis, and VNUE shall reimburse Promoter within Fifteen (15) Days of approval of such accounting.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces multiple contradictions regarding expense reimbursement. The original text specifies 'expenses' are reimbursed, now it says 'reasonable expenses', the reporting frequency changes from 'weekly' to 'monthly', and the reimbursement timeframe changes from 'Thirty (30) Days of receipt' to 'Fifteen (15) Days of approval'. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty about what expenses are covered, when they need to be reported, and when the payment should be expected.

perturbation.original_text: Section 6. Term. This Agreement shall commence on September 10, 2015 and shall continue for One (1) Year (the “Term”). At any time prior to the end of the Term, the Parties may agree in writing to extend the Agreement for successive One (1) Year periods (the “Renewal Terms”) under the same conditions set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 6. Term. This Agreement shall commence on September 10, 2015 and shall continue for One (1) Year (the “Term”). Either party may terminate this agreement at any time with thirty (30) days written notice. At any time prior to the end of the Term, the Parties may agree in writing to extend the Agreement for successive One (1) Year periods (the “Renewal Terms”) under the same conditions set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a conflicting termination clause. The original agreement specifies a one-year term with potential for renewal. The added sentence allows either party to terminate the agreement at any time with 30 days' notice. This directly contradicts the fixed one-year term, creating uncertainty and potential disputes over the agreement's duration and termination rights.
